These selections are all thumbnails of the original renders. Please select titles of interest to view the full image in a new window.

As detailed in the autobiographical essay, I tought myself 3DStudioR2 for DOS over the course of the last semester of my senior year at Linganore High School. For my final project, I recreated a Parker Fly electric guitar from scratch using graph paper and a small magazine advertisement. Because I did not have access to the official specifications of the guitar, this is only a surface recreation - none of the interior parts were necessary.



Blue Sky
Original Render - 3DSR2
1997

Cherry Flie
Final Print Render - 3DSR4
1997

Firefly
Revised Render - 3DS MAX 1.2
1998

As a result of my high school notariety for excellence in both technical drawing and computer aided drafting, I was referred the father of a girl in my graduating class for consulting work. He was interested in the possiblility of using 3D Studio to render illustrations for a scientific book he was publishing. After talking with him, we decided that equation ploting software like Mathematica would be a much easier tool for the precision realization of the sketches he brought. I have retained this test project that we drafted because of the interesting spatial possiblities his ideas produced.

Field Shell
Microfields - AutoCADR12, 3DS MAX 1.2
1997

From the Inside
Microfields - 3DS MAX 1.2, Photoshop
1997

Electron Microscope
Microfields - 3DS MAX 1.2, Photoshop
1997

A friend of mine asked that I work up a poster concept for him in 3DStudio. The only key elements I was given was the word Enigma and the form of a question mark.

Enigma Organic
Enigma - 3DS MAX 1.2, Photoshop
1999

Enigma Electric
Enigma - 3DS MAX 1.2, Photoshop
1999

Coffee?
Enigma - 3DS MAX 1.2, Photoshop
1999

As a rabid Led Zeppelin fan (I've since cooled off a bit) I used to be a member of the now renamed mailing list Digital Graphiti. While a member I helped in 2 tape trees, doing cover artwork for the cassettes being mailed around the world of bootleg concerts. Curious parties can peruse my tape list here.

Midnight Rehearsals
Digital Graphiti Tape Tree - Paint Shop Pro
1997

I have also created a few different image concepts for my band, Curious Yellow. Taking our name from Jeff Noon's novel Vurt, we have recorded one 4 song demo tape in the studio. I hope to make mp3's available of the demo songs soon so that I might attract a singer - we are currently lacking one.

Original Demo Artwork
Curious Yellow - Paint Shop Pro
1998

Dreamsnakes LP
Curious Yellow - Photoshop
1999

Dreamsnakes tile
Curious Yellow - Photoshop
1999

For my fourth semester at Frederick Community College, I enrolled in CM-108, a computer graphics survery type course designed to introduce students to Adobe's Quark and Illustrator while aquainting them with basic graphic design themes, styles and methods. Here, I was introduced to the Macintosh, a system I now enjoy working on, and familiarized with proper paper mounting and finnishing presentation techniques.
Asked to create a personal logo using one's first or last name, I designed this in Adobe Illustrator. Both variations are nicely altered through the use of Hue/Saturation adjustments to more conservative colors for alternate uses.


greenslate
CM-108 - Illustrator
1999


Purple Twist
CM-108 - Illustrator
1999


Tangle
CM-108 - Quark
1999


Itsy Bitsy
CM-108 - Illustrator
1999

These two advertisment style pieces push my interest in using negative space to force the eye. Tangle was designed to fill a magazine page, while Itsy Bitsy was designed as a Tabloid (11''x17'') poster for a fictional art exhibition.
Still 'under contruction' is the video portion of my portfolio. At FCC, I took two semesters of video production. During this time, I directed and edited three pieces that aired on FCC-TV, cable station 23 and participated in the creation of at least 4 other segments. Using the Media 100, I have learned to love non-linear editing of video With my fingers crossed as I type this, I want to try to digitize my current edits into the Mac at an extermely low bitrate and offer a few Quicktime clips. Stay Tuned!
